>     percentages-googlemercator.txt 
> 
> ...the first line is...
> 
> www.match.com              676     266143      0.25%    -265467
> 
> If "0.25%" is the percentage of the Google hits that Mercator
> got, then we would assume Mercator got 0.25% * 625 = 1.5625
> pages???

'-' size will tell you that the first number column (676) is x% (0.25)% of
the second number column (266143).
If the difference is positive then it is the other way around.

With Google this compression is not very useful since the upper limit is 
1000 URLs no matter what. But for actual crawls I find this numbers very 
useful. 

> ... we see that Mercator actually got 970 out of 1000 of Google's
> top hits, or 97%. 
> I'd like it if these more useful percentages were automatically
> calculated in the autosummary reports. 

Yes, we should do that.

i.
